result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIEL L HASSELMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 2:34 PM Defendant DANIEL L HASSELMAN in court.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for DANIEL L HASSELMAN.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with. State's sentencing recommendation is for a term of probation.  Defense argues for a fine and costs.  Victim appears in-person and make sentencing statement.

8:35 AM Defendant DANIEL L HASSELMAN in court.  Attorney Kirk William Everson in court for DANIEL L HASSELMAN.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Everson advises that matter is settled, requests adjourned plea/sentencing hearing. No objection by State.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
For Continuance of JT forwarded to Judge for signature.
